intro: Gonatandra, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to various regions in Australia, particularly in the south-eastern and western parts of the country. The plants are characterized by their unique, often intricate flower structures that resemble spiders, hence their common name. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Gonatandra species are generally small, terrestrial orchids with delicate, often fragrant blooms.
